body_html:
Do you have a specific example of the mismatch? IIUC, there is an expected difference since you are using dropout during training but not eval. If you want to compare training and eval predictions, you should try with keep_prob=1 during training.

Otherwise the graphs should matchup. If there are still differences between the graphs, i would recommend viewing them to see if there is anything unexpected or running corresponding intermediate nodes to try to identity where the difference appears.

Otherwise the graphs should matchup. If there are still differences between the graphs, i would recommend viewing them to see if there is anything unexpected or running corresponding intermediate nodes to try to identity where the difference appears.
body:
Do you have a specific example of the mismatch? IIUC, there is an expected difference since you are using dropout during training but not eval. If you want to compare training and eval predictions, you should try with keep_prob=1 during training.

Otherwise the graphs should matchup. If there are still differences between the graphs, i would recommend viewing them to see if there is anything unexpected or running corresponding intermediate nodes to try to identity where the difference appears.
